simplelogin-client

simplelogin-client

simplelogin-client

Zero-dependency TypeScript client for the SimpleLogin.io API. Compatible with NodeJS and browsers.

Documentation â€¢ API Spec

Features

The client is still in development. Below is a list of supported features. During the v0.* versions of this client, you may expect breaking changes to the client.

  • Account Management
    • Login (+MFA), Register, Activate, etc.
    • User info
    • API key management
  • Alias Management
    • Get, Create, Update, Delete
    • Contacts and activities
  • Mailbox Management
    • Get, Create, Update, Delete
  • Custom Domain Management
    • Get
    • Update, Delete
  • Contact Management
    • Get, Create
    • Delete
    • Block & unblock
  • Notifications
    • Get
    • Mark as read
  • Settings
    • Get, update
    • Get usable domains
  • Import & Export
    • Export user data
    • Export aliases CSV
  • Misc
    • Process Apple receipt
  • Phone
    • Get messages received during reservation

Getting started

simplelogin-client works in most NodeJS versions and browsers, but may require a tweak when not used with NodeJS 18 or in outdated browsers. Check the compatibility guide.

To start using this API client in your JS/TS projects:

# Install dependency
npm install --save simplelogin-client

import { SimpleLogin } from 'simplelogin-client';

const alias = new SimpleLogin.AliasApi({
  apiKey: process.env.API_KEY,
});

const createdAlias = await alias.createRandom({
  note: 'This alias was created with simplelogin-client!',
});

console.log(createdAlias);
/* Output:
{
  id: 50001,
  creation_date: '2023-02-10 20:19:37+00:00',
  alias: 'nederlanden_heatherington@example.com',
  mailbox: { email: 'somewhere@gmail.com', id: 50001 },
  enabled: true,
  pinned: false,
  note: "This alias was created with simplelogin-client!",
  ...
}
*/

Check the documentation for all available methods and the FAQ in case of questions.

Development

It's basically writing OpenAPI spec, to contribute code to this client.

The client is generated using swagger-codegen and the OpenAPI spec is written with boats.

Everything in ./dist & ./src/sdk is generated and should not be modified manually. To adjust the API client, docs or the built OpenAPI spec, adjust the YAML files in ./oas to document the API. Check the boats documentation and the OpenAPI v3 spec for further guidance.

Setup

Requires Docker & NodeJS 18+

# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start build of ./dist & ./src/sdk
npm run build

# During development the build can run when a source file was changed using
npm run dev

Build process

The build process is configured in scripts/build.ts and scripts/rebuild.ts. These scripts combine all the different CLI tools for the build process and ensures everthing fits together. They also modify some generated files to make them compatible.

Contribute

PRs are highly welcome. Remember to run the build and commit the generated files.
